qas.question: What are two types of fuses used for shells?
At shorter ranges a light weapon with what is used on fast targets?
What size of weapon calibers are better hitting at short range fast targets?
Smaller .50 caliber and 8 millimeter guns have been used in what?

context: The ammunition and shells fired by these weapons are usually fitted with different types of fuses (<a0_0>barometric, time-delay, or proximity<a0_0/>) to explode close to the airborne target, releasing a shower of fast metal fragments. For shorter-range work, a lighter weapon with <a1_0>a higher rate of fire<a1_0/> is required, to increase a hit probability on a fast airborne target. Weapons <a2_0>between 20 mm and 40 mm caliber<a2_0/> have been widely used in this role. Smaller weapons, typically .50 caliber or even 8 mm rifle caliber guns have been used in the <a3_0>smallest mounts<a3_0/>.
